135551072.review: Soy un padre de 50 años, probablemente una de las personas más viejas que juegan este juego. Soy padre soltero de mi hijo, que ahora tiene 14 años. Mi hijo recientemente descargó este juego y en menos de una semana, ya había jugado durante más de 20 horas. Esto fue terrible para mí, ya que ya era bastante difícil para mí pasar tiempo con mi hijo, ya que él siempre sale con sus amigos o simplemente mira videos en Tiktok. Así que decidí crear una cuenta de Steam y comprar este juego para ver si podía jugar junto a él. Cargué el juego, hice el tutorial pero estaba atascado en lo que se suponía que debías hacer. Le pedí ayuda a mi hijo y organizó un juego para que yo me uniera. Me encantó porque era el mejor momento que había pasado con mi hijo desde que mi esposa había muerto. Desde entonces, este juego ha acercado a mi hijo y a mí nuevamente y ahora también pasamos tiempo juntos fuera de la casa. Este juego me recordó que hay diversión en todo, y nos ha traído tanto a mí como a mi hijo muchos recuerdos felices.

One of the best indie platformers and one of the best indie games in general that I have played.
This game honestly is so amazing and brings that comforting and fun 3D platformer feel that I haven't felt in a games since anything from the PS2 and GameCube era, that might be just a me thing + nostalgia.
Even when you run out of stuff to do in the main game, there's practically infinite gameplay with the steam workshop and you can always replay the game and mod it how ever you like.
This is one area that I want to give the devs EXTRA credit on, seeing how much they support and acknowledge their modding community is amazing and I wish more studios and such did the same.
I will say that the DLC is amazing but some areas are a bit hit or miss, as great of a challenge as seal the deal is, that's about the most that DLC will offer.
Sure the new cruise level is plenty fun but the challenges you'll be doing on the other side of the DLC will be where like 80% of the content of the DLC is and they can be sometimes kinda tedious, the ability to avoid the extra challenges to 100% with peace and tranquility is plenty nice however and can help a lot. [spoiler](the boss rush one is still the only one I haven't done without peace and tranquility)[/spoiler]
Nyakuza Metro is such a solid DLC how ever, a wonderful experience from start to finish.
Vanessa's curse is decent, rough release aside it can be pretty fun. (good luck finding a game out and about)
Overall this game is a DEFINITE strong recommendation from me and one of the most solid indie games I have ever played, I love the style, the levels, the gameplay, characters, and the fun and wonder this game is oozing with.
Worth every penny.

135445652.review:
A Hat in Time is a game I absolutely adore, a game in which I feel like falls flat on it's face in terms of the DLC's, alongside the final true challenge of the game. Before I get to them however, I'd like to touch on things I love about this game.

The personality, the charm, and overall presentation of this game, is amazing. I absolutely adore how it looks, the platforming, level design, and controls, are absolutely amazing. Not only that but the bare bones story feels extremely refreshing. As much as I love games with story, this game doesn't try to do anything crazy, but overall I don't mind honestly. Overall, some of the achievements, while a bit dodgy and could do less without the multiplayer achievements, (honestly fuck this game for that.) overall some of the achievements were fun, but then we get to the last two.

Now, the Death Wish shit at the end, I absolutely fucking despise every bit of it. All of the challenges feel EXTREMELY unfair and VERY tedious to do half the time. You're barely given any room to fuck up for some of them and it doesn't feel rewarding nor does it feel satisfying to finally get them, honestly it just felt painful to do some of these god forbidden challenges, and then I didn't feel satisfied finally getting them, I was glad that it was over. (Which isn't a good thing at all.) 

Another thing I'd like to talk about is the Seal The Deal DLC. This DLC, is fucking embarrassing with how bad it is. I TRIED to like the Seal The Deal DLC, I really fucking did, but it's level design, it's challenge, it isn't rewarding NOR is it fun at all. It is probably one of the most horrible things I've ever played in a video game by far and it takes a lot for me to say that about a game that gives off such a good impression at the start, because I have genuine high hopes for whatever it has later on. 

While I have been mostly negative about this game, I have mostly been talking from a 100% perspective, and not a casual play perspective, I would say that this game is still worth a go. If you can ignore going for 100%, then go right ahead! I know this review was mostly negative but don't get me wrong, I don't hate nor do I dislike this game, I just think it's a very mixed bag for me in a few places.

Overall, I'd 100% give it a shot.

135066153.review: This game doesn't lie, it is indeed "cute as heck". A Hat in Time offers a joyful experience overflowing with well-written comedy and cute moments. The platforming is not particularly hard (the game is clearly designed around you not using the dive mechanic, and I didn't need the [spoiler]time stop hat[/spoiler] anywhere near as much as it thought I would) but it is very enjoyable nonetheless. There is a good mix of free-roam and more structured environments. Like all games, it inevitably has some frustrating moments, but I think a lot of them could have been avoided with minor changes to the game. However, overall, A Hat in Time is very fun.

After playing a lot more a hat in time I can say that this is one of the best 3D platformers I have ever played. This is definitely the best version of the game too, please don’t buy it for console and make the mistakes I made. This game takes HEAVY inspiration from Mario sunshine and others like it to create a very good platformer. One of the best things about the game is the modding community. There is a reason I have played so much of this game. The mods come directly inside of the steam workshop so no further downloads are required, with mod jams and challenge roads happening actively to this very day (April 4th 2023). The controls are fun to play with and second or even third playthroughs are inevitable.

In short to people browsing through seeing if it’s good…
10/10

135000170.review:
It feels a bit cruel to not recommend it when it's clear such effort has been put into this game. However one needs to keep in mind what this game is trying to compare itself to. The Mario series (and I assume more specifically Mario Sunshine) and it just doesn't match up to the quality.
Wolrds mostly feel without direction. There are pretty janky moments when jumping on certain shaped objects. I liked the Death wish parts though I feel that it contained ideas that they wanted to include in the main game but were concerned it couldn't fit in with the game's learning curve.
There is stuff to like though if you are truly desperate to scatch that sunshine itch. 
Overall it is a very charming game that doesn't quite live up to its inspiration. I do however really hope they make a sequel taking everything they have learnt from this one as it would be nice to have another super Mario sunshine.

134929127.review:
A Hat in Time is a vibrant and colorful platformer that has its moments of charm, but ultimately struggles to provide a cohesive experience. The game boasts a variety of worlds and mechanics, but they never seem to come together in a meaningful way.

As I ventured through the game, I was unable to find a solid narrative or overarching theme to tie it all together. The worlds felt disjointed, and the lack of a clear plot left me feeling somewhat uninvested in the experience. While the gameplay itself isn't terrible, it doesn't manage to elevate the game beyond its disjointed parts.

The game's systems don't seem to interact with each other in any particularly interesting or innovative ways, which is a shame considering the potential for unique mechanics in a platformer like this. Though there are moments of enjoyment to be found in A Hat in Time, they never quite build up to a memorable or engaging whole.

134514894.review:
It's VERY overhyped but still a solid platforming game. Chapter 2 is fantastic, and it really shows the potential the game had; unfortunately, the rest of the game ranges from just slightly above average to kinda bad (Chapter 4 lol).

Chapter 1 seemed to set up a bit of a story that I thought would be continued in the later chapters, but it doesn't get revisited until the end of the game. Every chapter in the game is like this actually; they all have their own storylines that don't come together until the very end. It's a bit disappointing, but a good story isn't required for a platformer: Super Mario Galaxy is similar and it's still a great game.

Also, the controls and camera aren't great. I don't really want to elaborate on this point but I'm sure other people have.

The steam workshop honestly might be the best part of the game. The levels people make can be really good, and there's lots of other mods that add fun things like Hat Kid swearing and playable Peter Griffin (hey lois im in hat in time). Overall, it adds a lot of replayability to the game.

I don't usually give scores for games, but I need a conclusion for this review soooo... I'm thinking a solid 7/10 for this game is about right.
